definition[0]: to take someone as your guest to a restaurant, cinema, club etc
example[0]: We’re taking my folks out for a meal next week.
definition[1]: to make a financial or legal arrangement with a bank, company, law court etc
example[1]: Before taking a loan out, calculate your monthly outgoings.
definition[2]: to get money from your bank account
example[2]: How much would you like to take out?
definition[3]: to borrow books from a library
example[3]: You can take out six books at a time.
definition[4]: to kill someone or destroy something
example[4]: The building was taken out by a bomb.
definition[5]: to arrange to get something officially, especially from an insurance company or a court of law
example[5]: I’m thinking of taking out a life insurance policy.
example[6]: If discounting took place without the publishers’ permission, they would take out an injunction  (=ask a court of law to give an order) to prevent it.
definition[6]: when investors who provided the capital to start a new business sell shares in the business once it has become successful
